definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Still, he cannot change the active nature.
sentences.chinese: 但他還是改不了“好動的本性”。

sentences.english: Children prefer climbing to hiking. They are full of beans.
sentences.chinese: 好動的孩子對爬山比行山更有興趣。

sentences.english: He once was a very active and happy boy.
sentences.chinese: 他以前很活潑好動，是一個快樂的孩子。

sentences.english: A. She compared the restless boy with a noisy monkey.
sentences.chinese: 她把那個好動的男孩比做一隻吵鬧的猴子。

sentences.english: The Labrador is an active breed.
sentences.chinese: 拉不拉多是很好動的品種。

sentences.english: That way, your dog will be less active during the day.
sentences.chinese: 那樣一來，您的愛犬在白天時就不會那麼好動。

sentences.english: This is also a great activity for your kinaesthetic learners.
sentences.chinese: 對於好動的學生來說，這更是一個很好的練習。

sentences.english: "He was very vigorous from Day One, " Meese said.
sentences.chinese: “它從第一天開始就很好動，”米斯說。

definition: variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to have tender affection for/to love tenderly/to pamper sb
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
